      • getServerStatus

        public StringData getServerStatus()
        Checking server status.
        Returns:
        Function returns UP/DOWN status for the primary game/platform environments. Data is cached once a minute.

        Returns:
        Returns information regarding a particular match.

      • getEsportsMatches

        public StringData getEsportsMatches()
        Getting E-Sport Machetes
        Returns:
        Returns the matchup information for each matchup for the current eSports Pro League season. An important return value is
        match_status
        which represents a match being scheduled (1), in-progress (2), or complete (3).

      • getFriends

        public StringData getFriends(java.lang.String username)
        Getting friend list from player
        Parameters:
        username - This may either be: a.) the Player Name, or b.) the Hi-Rez internally stored player_id (available to API developers via the getPlayer(String) API method).
        Returns:
        Returns the Smite User names of each of the player’s friends.

        Returns:
        Returns all Items and their various attributes.

      • getMatchIDsByQueue

        public StringData getMatchIDsByQueue(Smite.Queue queue,
                                     java.util.Date date,
                                     boolean allDay)
        Getting matches ID by Queue.
        Parameters:
        queue - the id of the game mode. See Smite.Queue
        date - Date using by Date or similar.
        allDay - An parameter represents it would be the entire day, but be warned that this may be more data than we can return for certain queues.
        Returns:
        Lists all Match IDs for a particular Match Queue; useful for API developers interested in constructing data by Queue.

      • getMatchIDsByQueue

        public StringData getMatchIDsByQueue(Paladins.Queue queue,
                                     java.util.Date date,
                                     boolean allDay)
        Getting matches ID by Queue.
        Parameters:
        queue - the id of the game mode. See Smite.Queue
        date - Date using by Date or similar. Required to limiting data return.
        allDay - An parameter represents it would be the entire day, but be warned that this may be more data than we can return for certain queues.
        Returns:
        Lists all Match IDs for a particular Match Queue; useful for API developers interested in constructing data by Queue.

      • getLeagueLeaderboard

        public StringData getLeagueLeaderboard(Smite.Queue queue,
                                       TierLeauge tier,
                                       java.lang.String season)
        Getting League Leaderboard
        Parameters:
        queue - the id of the game mode. See Smite.Queue
        tier - League tier. See TierLeauge
        season - The season of a league. Starts at 1 and increases by 1 for each calendar month
        Returns:
        Returns the top players for a particular league (as indicated by the queue/tier/season parameters).

      • getMatchHistory

        public StringData getMatchHistory(java.lang.String username)
        Gets recent matches and high level match statistics for a particular player.
        Parameters:
        username - This may either be: a.) the Player Name, or b.) the Hi-Rez internally stored player_id (available to API developers via the getPlayer(String) API method).
        Returns:
        Returns recent matches and high level match statistics for a particular player.

      • getMotd

        public StringData getMotd()
        Get Matches of the Day
        Returns:

      • getPlayer

        public StringData getPlayer(java.lang.String username)
        Get player information
        Parameters:
        username - This may either be: a.) the Player Name, or b.) the Hi-Rez internally stored player_id (available to API developers via the getPlayer(String) API method).
        Returns:
        Returns league and other high level data for a particular player.

      • getPlayerStatus

        public StringData getPlayerStatus(java.lang.String username)
        Getting player status in the game
        Parameters:
        username - This may either be: a.) the Player Name, or b.) the Hi-Rez internally stored player_id (available to API developers via the getPlayer(String) API method).
        Returns:
        Returns player status as follows:
        0
        - Offline
        1
        - In Lobby (basically anywhere except god selection or in game)
        2
        - god Selection (player has accepted match and is selecting god before start of game)
        3
        - In Game (match has started)
        4
        - Online (player is logged in, but may be blocking broadcast of player state)
        5
        - Unknown (player not found)

      • getQueueStats

        public StringData getQueueStats(java.lang.String username,
                                Smite.Queue queue)
        Parameters:
        username - This may either be: a.) the Player Name, or b.) the Hi-Rez internally stored player_id (available to API developers via the getPlayer(String) API method).
        queue - the id of the game mode. See Smite.Queue
        Returns:
        Returns match summary statistics for a (player, queue) combination grouped by gods played.

      • getTopMatches

        public StringData getTopMatches()
        Getting top matches.
        Returns:
        Lists the 50 most watched / most recent recorded matches.

      • getPlayerAchievements

        public StringData getPlayerAchievements(java.lang.String username)
        getting player achievements
        Parameters:
        username - This may either be: a.) the Player Name, or b.) the Hi-Rez internally stored player_id (available to API developers via the getPlayer(String) API method).
        Returns:
        Returns select achievement totals (Double kills, Tower Kills, First Bloods, etc) for the specified playerId.

      • getPlayerAchievements

        public StringData getPlayerAchievements(int playerId)
        getting player achievements
        Parameters:
        playerId - This is the Player ID generated by getPlayer(String)
        Returns:
        Returns select achievement totals (Double kills, Tower Kills, First Bloods, etc) for the specified playerId.

      • getPatchInfo

        public StringData getPatchInfo()
        Getting information about current deployed patch
        Returns:
        Function returns information about current deployed patch. Currently, this information only includes patch version.
